hanzi-su-wiki:
託

Значения

Поручать, доверять; ссылаться на что-либо, отговариваться

Мнемоника

Искать протекции, поддержки 乇 силой чужих слов 言.

Варианты

讬, 托
purpleculture_pinyin:
tuō
to trust; to entrust; to be entrusted with; to act as trustee; variant of 托
доверять; доверить; быть доверенным; выступать в качестве доверительного управляющего; вариант 托
rtega_mnemonic:
託託RSentrust, rely on, request, commission
  • words 言 entrusted or relied 乇 on
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 托)
Ideographic: To depend on 乇 someone's word 言; 乇 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 乇 [ tuō ] to depend on, to entrust with
heisig_chinese_memo: When you entrust a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).
heisig_constituent: consign, say, words, keitai, mouth, lock of hair
Keyword_KANJIDIC: consign, requesting, entrusting with, pretend, hint
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: предавать, запрашивая, доверив с, притворитесь, намек
koohiiStory1: When you consign a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don´t keep their word).
koohiiStory2: In "The Lord of the Rings", Galadriel consigned a lock of her hair to Gimli the dwarf, along with some wise words.
kunYomi: かこつ.ける、かこ.つ、かこ.つける
jp_example_words: 委託(いたく): consign (goods (for sale) to a firm), entrust (person with something), commit
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: They say if you put things on a slide, seven things to be exact, that’s the best way to consign goods to someone. They say if you consign seven things to someone, you should send them over on a slide. Slide ‘em on down. All seven of ‘em.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine what seven things you consign over to this other person for safekeeping. Visualize them in your head as you slide each one down the slide.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: One of the seven things you consign over to this guy is a tack (たく). It’s the sharpest tack you’ve ever seen. You slide the tack down the slide. Good thing no one is on the slide now, sitting on that tack would hurt.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Let’s imagine what it would be like to hit this tack while sliding on the slide. It would hurt. Good thing you are consigning it over to someone. Probably safer for everyone that way.
Ru_Meaning: consign, requesting, entrusting with, pretend, hint
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 話 (はなす、ワ разговор, речь), 詰 (つめる、なじる、キツ、キチ набивать, упаковывать), 詫 (わびる、タ просить прощения), 諮 (はかる、シ совет, чужое мнение).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ノ, 乙 (второй), 言 (слово)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: Mo's (乇) words (言) can be entrusted
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When you entrust a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).
humanum_short_description_en:
The inscriptions from the " words " and " tor " are used as the names of people, and they are pronounced as "姹", "Jade Pian": "姹, beautiful women." Cai Hou Zun: "Song (Rong) support (姹) Shang (Zhang) )", "霝 Rong" means a beautiful face, and "姹 Zhang" means bright and beautiful, describing a girl with a beautiful face (see the selection of bronze inscriptions from the Shang and Zhou Dynasties).

"Shuowen": "Trust, send. From words to torsion."
humanum_short_description:
金文從「言」，「乇」聲，用作人名，又讀作「奼」，《玉篇》：「奼，美女也。」蔡侯尊：「霝頌(容)託(奼)商(彰)」，「霝容」表示美好的容貌，「奼彰」表示明媚，形容少女容貌美麗(參商周青銅器銘文選)。

　　《說文》：「託，寄也。从言乇聲。」

託託RS entrust, rely on, request, commission
  • words 言 entrusted or relied 乇 on
(Simplified: 托)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: To depend on 乇 someone's word 言; 乇 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 乇 [ tuō ] to depend on, to entrust with
①用手掌承着東西：兩手託着下巴。
②陪襯，鋪墊：襯托。烘托。
③承着器物的東西：托盤。
④寄，暫放：託身；託跡(均指遁居深山寄身於世外，以逃避世事)。
⑤請別人代辦：委託。拜託。囑託。
⑥藉故推委或躲閃：推託。託故。
⑦信賴，憑藉：託名。託庇。
⑧壓強單位。

託字的基本解释

託
tuō
见“讬”。

託字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuō］
［《廣韻》他各切，入鐸，透。］
亦作“托1”。“讬1”的繁体字。
(1)寄托；寄寓。
(2)凭借；依赖。
(3)托付；请托。
(4)假托；推托。
(5)以手掌或其他东西向上承受物体。

託字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　託； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1149第01
【唐韻】【正韻】他各切【集韻】【韻會】闥各切，?音拓。【說文】寄也。【揚子·方言】凡寄爲託。【玉篇】憑依也。【增韻】委也，信任也。【穀梁傳·定元年】夫請者，非可詒託而往也。【范註】詒託，猶假寄。【禮·檀弓】久矣，予之不託於音也。【鄭註】寄也。【前漢·賈山傳】聚廬而託處。【唐書·李勣傳】勣旣忠力，帝謂可託大事。【說苑·善說篇】上士可以託色，中士可以託辭，下士可以託財。　又【正字通】寓言也。【後漢·姜肱傳】託以他辭，終不言盜。　又州名。【唐書·地理志】隴右道有託州。　又南詔官名。【唐書·南蠻傳】乞託主馬，祿託主牛，巨託主倉廩。　又【韻會】或作侂。【說文】《論語》可以侂六尺之孤。今文作託。宋韓侂胄名取此。　又或作寓。【禮·郊特牲】諸侯不臣寓公。【註】寓，寄也。或爲託。　又【集韻】陟嫁切，音吒。誇也。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [tuō]
["Guangyun" he cuts each, enters the priest, and is thorough. ]
Also known as "support 1". Traditional characters for "讬1".
(1) Suspension; Suspension.
(2) Rely on; rely on.
(3) Entrust; please entrust.
(4) False trust; Dodge.
(5) Hold the object upward with the palm or other things.

tuō
вм. 托
Radicals: 言, 丿, 七  (say, slide, seven)
Meaning Mnemonic
They say if you put things on a slide, seven things to be exact, that’s the best way to consign goods to someone. They say if you consign seven things to someone, you should send them over on a slide. Slide ‘em on down. All seven of ‘em.
Imagine what seven things you consign over to this other person for safekeeping. Visualize them in your head as you slide each one down the slide.
Reading Mnemonic
One of the seven things you consign over to this guy is a tack (たく). It’s the sharpest tack you’ve ever seen. You slide the tack down the slide. Good thing no one is on the slide now, sitting on that tack would hurt.
Let’s imagine what it would be like to hit this tack while sliding on the slide. It would hurt. Good thing you are consigning it over to someone. Probably safer for everyone that way.
